member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcTypeParametersInferredAreNotStable
member.summary:
The type parameters inferred for this value are not stable under the erasure of type abbreviations. This is due to the use of type abbreviations which drop or reorder type parameters, e.g. 
	type taggedInt<'a> = int or
	type swap<'a,'b> = 'b * 'a.
Consider declaring the type parameters for this value explicitly, e.g.
	let f<'a,'b> ((x,y) : swap<'b,'a>) : swap<'a,'b> = (y,x). (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:513)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcTypeAbbreviationsCheckedAtCompileTime

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcTypeAbbreviationsCannotHaveInterfaceDeclaration
member.summary: Type abbreviations cannot have interface declarations (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:750)

member.summary: Type abbreviations cannot have augmentations (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:812)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcTypeAbbreviationHasTypeParametersMissingOnType
member.summary: This type abbreviation has one or more declared type parameters that do not appear in the type being abbreviated. Type abbreviations must use all declared type parameters in the type being abbreviated. Consider removing one or more type parameters, or use a concrete type definition that wraps an underlying type, such as 'type C<'a> = C of ...'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:775)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcTupleStructMismatch

member.summary: 'try'/'with' cannot be used within sequence expressions (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:645)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcThreadStaticAndContextStaticMustBeStatic

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStructuralEqualityNotSatisfied2(System.String,System.String)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStructuralEqualityNotSatisfied1(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The struct, record or union type '%s' has the 'StructuralEquality' attribute but the type parameter '%s' does not satisfy the 'equality' constraint. Consider adding the 'equality' constraint to the type parameter (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1056)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStructuralComparisonNotSatisfied2(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The struct, record or union type '%s' has the 'StructuralComparison' attribute but the component type '%s' does not satisfy the 'comparison' constraint (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1051)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStructuralComparisonNotSatisfied1(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The struct, record or union type '%s' has the 'StructuralComparison' attribute but the type parameter '%s' does not satisfy the 'comparison' constraint. Consider adding the 'comparison' constraint to the type parameter (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1050)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStructsMustDeclareTypesOfImplicitCtorArgsExplicitly
member.summary: Each argument of the primary constructor for a struct must be given a type, for example 'type S(x1:int, x2: int) = ...'. These arguments determine the fields of the struct. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1058)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStructsMayNotContainLetBindings
member.summary: Structs cannot contain value definitions because the default constructor for structs will not execute these bindings. Consider adding additional arguments to the primary constructor for the type. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:746)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStructsMayNotContainDoBindings
member.summary: Structs cannot contain 'do' bindings because the default constructor for structs would not execute these bindings (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:745)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStructsInterfacesEnumsDelegatesMayNotInheritFromOtherTypes
member.summary: Structs, interfaces, enums and delegates cannot inherit from other types (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:776)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStructsCannotHaveConstructorWithNoArguments
member.summary: Structs cannot have an object constructor with no arguments. This is a restriction imposed on all CLI languages as structs automatically support a default constructor. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:717)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStructsCanOnlyBindThisAtMemberDeclaration
member.summary: Structs may only bind a 'this' parameter at member declarations (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:507)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStructUnionMultiCaseDistinctFields
member.summary: If a union type has more than one case and is a struct, then all fields within the union type must be given unique names. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1377)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStructTypesCannotContainAbstractMembers
member.summary: Struct types cannot contain abstract members (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:796)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStaticValFieldsMustBeMutableAndPrivate
member.summary: Static 'val' fields in types must be mutable, private and marked with the '[<DefaultValue>]' attribute. They are initialized to the 'null' or 'zero' value for their type. Consider also using a 'static let mutable' binding in a class type. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:728)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStaticOptimizationConditionalsOnlyForFSharpLibrary
member.summary: Static optimization conditionals are only for use within the F# library (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:666)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStaticMemberShouldNotHaveThis
member.summary: This static member should not have a 'this' parameter. Consider using the notation 'member Member(args) = ...'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:526)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStaticLetBindingsRequireClassesWithImplicitConstructors
member.summary: Static value definitions may only be used in types with a primary constructor. Consider adding arguments to the type definition, e.g. 'type X(args) = ...'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:747)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStaticInitializersIllegalInInterface
member.summary: Interfaces cannot contain definitions of static initializers (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:712)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStaticInitializerRequiresArgument
member.summary: A static initializer requires an argument (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:524)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcStaticFieldUsedWhenInstanceFieldExpected
member.summary: A static field was used where an instance field is expected (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:475)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcSimpleMethodNameRequired
member.summary: A simple method name is required here (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:619)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcSeqResultsUseYield
member.summary: In sequence expressions, results are generated using 'yield' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:481)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcRuntimeSuppliedMethodCannotBeUsedInUserCode(System.String)
member.summary: Array method '%s' is supplied by the runtime and cannot be directly used in code. For operations with array elements consider using family of GetArray/SetArray functions from LanguagePrimitives.IntrinsicFunctions module. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1339)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcReturnValuesCannotHaveNames
member.summary: Return values cannot have names (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:487)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcReturnTypesForUnionMustBeSameAsType
member.summary: Return types of union cases must be identical to the type being defined, up to abbreviations (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:732)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcReturnMayNotBeUsedInQueries
member.summary: 'return' and 'return!' may not be used in queries (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1308)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcResumableCodeNotSupported
member.summary: Using resumable code or resumable state machines requires /langversion:preview (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1617)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcResumableCodeInvocation
member.summary: Resumable code invocation. Suppress this warning if you are defining new low-level resumable code in terms of existing resumable code. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1621)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcResumableCodeFunctionMustBeInline
member.summary: Invalid resumable code. Any method of function accepting or returning resumable code must be marked 'inline' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1613)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcResumableCodeContainsLetRec
member.summary: Invalid resumable code. A 'let rec' occured in the resumable code specification (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1616)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcResumableCodeArgMustHaveRightName
member.summary: Invalid resumable code. Resumable code parameter must have name beginning with '__expand' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1614)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcResumableCodeArgMustHaveRightKind
member.summary: Invalid resumable code. A resumable code parameter must be of delegate or function type (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1615)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcReservedSyntaxForAugmentation
member.summary: The syntax 'type X with ...' is reserved for augmentations. Types whose representations are hidden but which have members are now declared in signatures using 'type X = ...'. You may also need to add the '[<Sealed>] attribute to the type definition in the signature (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:804)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcRequireVarConstRecogOrLiteral
member.summary: This is not a variable, constant, active recognizer or literal (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:577)

member.summary: The 'let! ... and! ...' construct may only be used if the computation expression builder defines either a '%s' method or appropriate 'MergeSource' and 'Bind' methods (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1517)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcRequireBuilderMethod(System.String)
member.summary: This control construct may only be used if the computation expression builder defines a '%s' method (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:556)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcRequireActivePatternWithOneResult
member.summary: Only active patterns returning exactly one result may accept arguments (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:569)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcRepresentationOfTypeHiddenBySignature

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcRecursiveBindingsWithMembersMustBeDirectAugmentation
member.summary: Recursive bindings that include member specifications can only occur as a direct augmentation of a type (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:719)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcRecordsUnionsAbbreviationsStructsMayNotHaveAllowNullLiteralAttribute
member.summary: Records, union, abbreviations and struct types cannot have the 'AllowNullLiteral' attribute (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:778)

member.summary: This record contains fields from inconsistent types (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:505)

member.summary: The 'rec' on this module is implied by an outer 'rec' declaration and is being ignored (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1372)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcPropertyRequiresExplicitTypeParameters
member.summary: A property cannot have explicit type parameters. Consider using a method instead. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:520)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcPropertyOrFieldNotFoundInAttribute
member.summary: This property or field was not found on this custom attribute type (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:693)

member.summary: Property '%s' is static (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:657)

member.summary: Property '%s' is not static (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:654)

member.summary: Property '%s' is not readable (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:655)

member.summary: Property '%s' cannot be set (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:658)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcPropertyCannotBeSet0
member.summary: This property cannot be set (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:692)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcPredefinedTypeCannotBeUsedAsSuperType
member.summary: The types System.ValueType, System.Enum, System.Delegate, System.MulticastDelegate and System.Array cannot be used as super types in an object expression or class (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:620)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcParenThenAdjacentListArgumentReserved
member.summary: The syntax '(expr1)[expr2]' is now reserved for indexing and is ambiguous when used as an argument. See https://aka.ms/fsharp-index-notation. If calling a function with multiple curried arguments, add a space between them, e.g. 'someFunction (expr1) [expr2]'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1564)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcParenThenAdjacentListArgumentNeedsAdjustment
member.summary: The syntax '(expr1)[expr2]' is ambiguous when used as an argument. See https://aka.ms/fsharp-index-notation. If you intend indexing or slicing then you must use '(expr1).[expr2]' in argument position. If calling a function with multiple curried arguments, add a space between them, e.g. 'someFunction (expr1) [expr2]'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1567)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcParameterRequiresName
member.summary: A parameter with attributes must also be given a name, e.g. '[<Attribute>] Name : Type' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:486)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcParameterInferredByref(System.String)
member.summary: The parameter '%s' was inferred to have byref type. Parameters of byref type must be given an explicit type annotation, e.g. 'x1: byref<int>'. When used, a byref parameter is implicitly dereferenced. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1075)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOverridingMethodRequiresAllOrNoTypeParameters
member.summary: You must explicitly declare either all or no type parameters when overriding a generic abstract method (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:515)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOverridesCannotHaveVisibilityDeclarations
member.summary: Accessibility modifiers are not permitted on overrides or interface implementations (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:785)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOverrideArityMismatch(System.String)
member.summary: This override takes a different number of arguments to the corresponding abstract member. The following abstract members were found:%s (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:704)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOverloadsCannotHaveCurriedArguments
member.summary: One or more of the overloads of this method has curried arguments. Consider redesigning these members to take arguments in tupled form. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:664)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOtherThenAdjacentListArgumentReserved
member.summary: The syntax 'expr1[expr2]' is now reserved for indexing and is ambiguous when used as an argument. See https://aka.ms/fsharp-index-notation. If calling a function with multiple curried arguments, add a space between them, e.g. 'someFunction expr1 [expr2]'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1566)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOtherThenAdjacentListArgumentNeedsAdjustment
member.summary: The syntax 'expr1[expr2]' is ambiguous when used as an argument. See https://aka.ms/fsharp-index-notation. If you intend indexing or slicing then you must use 'expr1.[expr2]' in argument position. If calling a function with multiple curried arguments, add a space between them, e.g. 'someFunction expr1 [expr2]'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1569)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOptionalArgumentsCannotBeUsedInCustomAttribute
member.summary: Optional arguments cannot be used in custom attributes (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:691)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOptionalArgsOnlyOnMembers
member.summary: Optional arguments are only permitted on type members (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:565)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOptionalArgsMustComeAfterNonOptionalArgs
member.summary: Optional arguments must come at the end of the argument list, after any non-optional arguments (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1101)

member.summary: '%s' must be followed by 'in'. Usage: %s. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1333)

member.summary: Incorrect syntax for '%s'. Usage: %s. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1261)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOperatorDoesntAcceptInto(System.String)
member.summary: The operator '%s' does not accept the use of 'into' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1295)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOpenUsedWithPartiallyQualifiedPath(System.String)
member.summary: This declaration opens the namespace or module '%s' through a partially qualified path. Adjust this code to use the full path of the namespace. This change will make your code more robust as new constructs are added to the F# and CLI libraries. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:739)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOpenFirstInMutRec
member.summary: In a recursive declaration group, 'open' declarations must come first in each module (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1373)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOnlyTypesRepresentingUnitsOfMeasureCanHaveMeasure
member.summary: Only types representing units-of-measure may be given the 'Measure' attribute (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:784)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOnlyStructsCanHaveStructLayout
member.summary: Only structs and classes without primary constructors may be given the 'StructLayout' attribute (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:781)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOnlySimplePatternsInLetRec
member.summary: Only simple variable patterns can be bound in 'let rec' constructs (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:720)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOnlySimpleBindingsCanBeUsedInConstructionExpressions
member.summary: Only simple bindings of the form 'id = expr' can be used in construction expressions (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:626)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOnlyRecordFieldsAndSimpleLetCanBeMutable
member.summary: Mutable 'let' bindings can't be recursive or defined in recursive modules or namespaces (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:721)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOnlyFunctionsCanBeInline
member.summary: Only functions may be marked 'inline' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:680)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcOnlyClassesCanHaveAbstract
member.summary: Only classes may be given the 'AbstractClass' attribute (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:783)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcObjectsMustBeInitializedWithObjectExpression
member.summary: Objects must be initialized by an object construction expression that calls an inherited object constructor and assigns a value to each field (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:627)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcObjectOfIndeterminateTypeUsedRequireTypeConstraint
member.summary: The operator 'expr.[idx]' has been used on an object of indeterminate type based on information prior to this program point. Consider adding further type constraints (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:600)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcObjectExpressionsCanOnlyOverrideAbstractOrVirtual
member.summary: Only overrides of abstract and virtual members may be specified in object expressions (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:614)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcObjectExpressionFormDeprecated
member.summary: This form of object expression is not used in F#. Use 'member this.MemberName ... = ...' to define member implementations in object expressions. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:530)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcObjectConstructorsOnTypeParametersCannotTakeArguments
member.summary: Calls to object constructors on type parameters cannot be given arguments (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:602)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcObjectConstructorsIllegalInInterface
member.summary: Interfaces cannot contain definitions of object constructors (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:713)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcObjectConstructorRequiresArgument
member.summary: An object constructor requires an argument (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:525)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcObjectConstructionExpressionCanOnlyImplementConstructorsInObjectModelTypes
member.summary: Object construction expressions (i.e. record expressions with inheritance specifications) may only be used to implement constructors in object model types. Use 'new ObjectType(args)' to construct instances of object model types outside of constructors (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:637)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcObjectConstructionCanOnlyBeUsedInClassTypes
member.summary: Object construction expressions may only be used to implement constructors in class types (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:625)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNumericLiteralRequiresModule(System.String)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNotValidEnumCaseName
member.summary: This is not a valid name for an enumeration case (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:593)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNotSufficientlyGenericBecauseOfScope(System.String)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNotAnIndexerNamedIndexingNotYetEnabled(System.String)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNotAnIndexerIndexingNotYetEnabled
member.summary: This expression is not a function and does not support index notation. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1554)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNotAnException
member.summary: Not an exception (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:767)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNotAFunctionButIndexerNamedIndexingNotYetEnabled(System.String,System.String)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNotAFunctionButIndexerIndexingNotYetEnabled
member.summary: This expression supports indexing, e.g. 'expr.[index]'. The syntax 'expr[index]' requires /langversion:preview. See https://aka.ms/fsharp-index-notation. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1552)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNonZeroConstantCannotHaveGenericUnit
member.summary: Non-zero constants cannot have generic units. For generic zero, write 0.0<_>. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:480)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNonUniformMemberUse(System.String)
member.summary: The generic member '%s' has been used at a non-uniform instantiation prior to this program point. Consider reordering the members so this member occurs first. Alternatively, specify the full type of the member explicitly, including argument types, return type and any additional generic parameters and constraints. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1076)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNonSimpleLetBindingInQuery
member.summary: This 'let' definition may not be used in a query. Only simple value definitions may be used in queries. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1311)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNonLiteralCannotBeUsedInPattern
member.summary: This value is not a literal and cannot be used in a pattern (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:538)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoWhileInQuery
member.summary: 'while' expressions may not be used in queries (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1304)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoTryFinallyInQuery
member.summary: 'try/finally' expressions may not be used in queries (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1305)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoPropertyFoundForOverride
member.summary: No abstract property was found that corresponds to this override (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:707)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoMemberFoundForOverride
member.summary: No abstract or interface member was found that corresponds to this override (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:703)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoInterfaceImplementationForConstructionExpression
member.summary: Interface implementations cannot be given on construction expressions (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:624)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoIntegerForLoopInQuery
member.summary: In queries, use the form 'for x in n .. m do ...' for ranging over integers (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1303)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoEqualityNeeded2(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The struct, record or union type '%s' does not support structural equality because the type '%s' does not satisfy the 'equality' constraint. Consider adding the 'NoEquality' attribute to the type '%s' to clarify that the type does not support structural equality (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1055)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoEqualityNeeded1(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The struct, record or union type '%s' does not support structural equality because the type parameter %s does not satisfy the 'equality' constraint. Consider adding the 'NoEquality' attribute to the type '%s' to clarify that the type does not support structural equality (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1054)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoEagerConstraintApplicationAttribute
member.summary: Using methods with 'NoEagerConstraintApplicationAttribute' requires /langversion:6.0 or later (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1618)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoComparisonNeeded2(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The struct, record or union type '%s' is not structurally comparable because the type '%s' does not satisfy the 'comparison' constraint. Consider adding the 'NoComparison' attribute to the type '%s' to clarify that the type is not comparable (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1053)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoComparisonNeeded1(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The struct, record or union type '%s' is not structurally comparable because the type parameter %s does not satisfy the 'comparison' constraint. Consider adding the 'NoComparison' attribute to the type '%s' to clarify that the type is not comparable (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1052)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoArgumentsForRecordValue
member.summary: No arguments may be given when constructing a record value (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:623)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNoAbstractOrVirtualMemberFound(System.String)
member.summary: The member '%s' does not correspond to any abstract or virtual method available to override or implement. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:615)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNewRequiresObjectConstructor
member.summary: 'new' may only be used with object constructors (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:631)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNewMustBeUsedWithNamedType
member.summary: 'new' must be used with a named type (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:621)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNewMemberHidesAbstractMemberWithSuffix(System.String)
member.summary: This new member hides the abstract member '%s' once tuples, functions, units of measure and/or provided types are erased. Rename the member or use 'override' instead. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:711)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNewMemberHidesAbstractMember(System.String)
member.summary: This new member hides the abstract member '%s'. Rename the member or use 'override' instead. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:710)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNewCannotBeUsedOnInterfaceType
member.summary: 'new' cannot be used on interface types. Consider using an object expression '{ new ... with ... }' instead. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:606)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNamespaceCannotContainValues
member.summary: Namespaces cannot contain values. Consider using a module to hold your value declarations. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:489)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNamespaceCannotContainExtensionMembers
member.summary: Namespaces cannot contain extension members except in the same file and namespace declaration group where the type is defined. Consider using a module to hold declarations of extension members. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:490)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNamedTypeRequired(System.String)
member.summary: '%s' may only be used with named types (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:604)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNamedArgumentsCannotBeUsedInMemberTraits
member.summary: Named arguments cannot be given to member trait calls (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:592)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNamedArgumentDidNotMatch(System.String)
member.summary: The named argument '%s' did not match any argument or mutable property (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:663)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNamedActivePattern(System.String)
member.summary: %s is an active pattern and cannot be treated as a discriminated union case with named fields. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1382)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNameNotBoundInPattern(System.String)
member.summary: Name '%s' not bound in pattern context (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:566)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcNameArgumentsMustAppearLast
member.summary: Named arguments must appear after all other arguments (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:540)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMutableValuesSyntax
member.summary: Mutable function values should be written 'let mutable f = (fun args -> ...)' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:679)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMutableValuesMayNotHaveGenericParameters
member.summary: Mutable values cannot have generic parameters (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:678)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMutableValuesCannotBeInline
member.summary: Mutable values cannot be marked 'inline' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:677)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMultipleVisibilityAttributesWithLet
member.summary: Multiple visibility attributes have been specified for this identifier. 'let' bindings in classes are always private, as are any 'let' bindings inside expressions. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:492)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMultipleVisibilityAttributes
member.summary: Multiple visibility attributes have been specified for this identifier (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:491)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcModuleRequiresQualifiedAccess(System.String)
member.summary: This declaration opens the module '%s', which is marked as 'RequireQualifiedAccess'. Adjust your code to use qualified references to the elements of the module instead, e.g. 'List.map' instead of 'map'. This change will ensure that your code is robust as new constructs are added to libraries. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:738)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcModuleAbbreviationForNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: The path '%s' is a namespace. A module abbreviation may not abbreviate a namespace. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:813)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcModuleAbbrevFirstInMutRec
member.summary: In a recursive declaration group, module abbreviations must come after all 'open' declarations and before other declarations (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1374)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMissingCustomOperation(System.String)
member.summary: A custom query operation for '%s' is required but not specified (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1233)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMethodOverridesIllegalHere
member.summary: Method overrides and interface implementations are not permitted here (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:702)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMethodNotAccessible(System.String)
member.summary: Method '%s' is not accessible from this code location (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:476)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMembersThatExtendInterfaceMustBePlacedInSeparateModule
member.summary: Members that extend interface, delegate or enum types must be placed in a module separate to the definition of the type. This module must either have the AutoOpen attribute or be opened explicitly by client code to bring the extension members into scope. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:805)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMemberUsedInInvalidWay(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The member '%s' is used in an invalid way. A use of '%s' has been inferred prior to the definition of '%s', which is an invalid forward reference. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:815)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMemberOverridesIllegalInInterface
member.summary: Interfaces cannot contain definitions of member overrides (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:714)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMemberOperatorDefinitionInExtrinsic
member.summary: Extension members cannot provide operator overloads. Consider defining the operator as part of the type definition instead. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1104)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMemberNotPermittedInInterfaceImplementation
member.summary: This member is not permitted in an interface implementation (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:755)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMemberKindPropertyGetSetNotExpected
member.summary: SynMemberKind.PropertyGetSet only expected in parse trees (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:488)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMemberIsNotSufficientlyGeneric
member.summary: This member is not sufficiently generic (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:722)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMemberFoundIsNotAbstractOrVirtual(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The type %s contains the member '%s' but it is not a virtual or abstract method that is available to override or implement. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:616)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMemberAndLocalClassBindingHaveSameName(System.String)
member.summary: A member and a local class binding both have the name '%s' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:749)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMeasureDefinitionsCannotHaveTypeParameters
member.summary: Measure definitions cannot have type parameters (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:773)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMeasureDeclarationsRequireStaticMembersNotConstructors
member.summary: Measure declarations may have only static members: constructors are not available (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:748)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMeasureDeclarationsRequireStaticMembers
member.summary: Measure declarations may have only static members (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:744)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcMatchMayNotBeUsedWithQuery
member.summary: 'match' expressions may not be used in queries (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1330)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcLookupMayNotBeUsedHere
member.summary: This lookup cannot be used here (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:656)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcLocalClassBindingsCannotBeInline
member.summary: Local class bindings cannot be marked inline. Consider lifting the definition out of the class or else do not mark it as inline. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:740)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcLiteralFieldAssignmentWithArg(System.String)
member.summary: Cannot assign '%s' to a value marked literal (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1558)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcLiteralFieldAssignmentNoArg
member.summary: Cannot assign a value to another value marked literal (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1559)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcLiteralDoesNotTakeArguments
member.summary: This literal pattern does not take arguments (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1362)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcLiteralCannotHaveGenericParameters
member.summary: Literal values cannot have generic parameters (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:684)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcLiteralCannotBeMutable
member.summary: A literal value cannot be marked 'mutable' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:682)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcLiteralCannotBeInline
member.summary: A literal value cannot be marked 'inline' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:683)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcLiteralAttributeRequiresConstantValue
member.summary: A declaration may only be the [<Literal>] attribute if a constant value is also given, e.g. 'val x: int = 1' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:723)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcLiteralAttributeCannotUseActivePattern
member.summary: A [<Literal>] declaration cannot use an active pattern for its identifier (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1610)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcListThenAdjacentListArgumentReserved
member.summary: The syntax '[expr1][expr2]' is now reserved for indexing and is ambiguous when used as an argument. See https://aka.ms/fsharp-index-notation. If calling a function with multiple curried arguments, add a space between them, e.g. 'someFunction [expr1] [expr2]'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1565)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcListThenAdjacentListArgumentNeedsAdjustment
member.summary: The syntax '[expr1][expr2]' is ambiguous when used as an argument. See https://aka.ms/fsharp-index-notation. If you intend indexing or slicing then you must use '(expr1).[expr2]' in argument position. If calling a function with multiple curried arguments, add a space between them, e.g. 'someFunction [expr1] [expr2]'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1568)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcListLiteralMaxSize
member.summary: This list expression exceeds the maximum size for list literals. Use an array for larger literals and call Array.ToList. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:590)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcLetAndDoRequiresImplicitConstructionSequence
member.summary: This definition may only be used in a type with a primary constructor. Consider adding arguments to your type definition, e.g. 'type X(args) = ...'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:811)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcLessGenericBecauseOfAnnotation(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This code is less generic than required by its annotations because the explicit type variable '%s' could not be generalized. It was constrained to be '%s'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:509)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcKindOfTypeSpecifiedDoesNotMatchDefinition
member.summary: The kind of the type specified by its attributes does not match the kind implied by its definition (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:772)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcJoinMustUseSimplePattern(System.String)
member.summary: In queries, '%s' must use a simple pattern (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1232)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcIsReadOnlyNotStruct
member.summary: A type annotated with IsReadOnly must also be a struct. Consider adding the [<Struct>] attribute to the type. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1494)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidUseOfTypeName
member.summary: Invalid use of a type name (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:648)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidUseOfReverseIndex
member.summary: Invalid use of reverse index in list expression. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1560)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidUseOfInterfaceType
member.summary: Invalid use of an interface type (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:652)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidUseOfDelegate
member.summary: Invalid use of a delegate constructor. Use the syntax 'new Type(args)' or just 'Type(args)'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:653)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidUseNullAsTrueValue
member.summary: The 'UseNullAsTrueValue' attribute flag may only be used with union types that have one nullary case and at least one non-nullary case (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1074)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidUseBinding
member.summary: 'use' bindings must be of the form 'use <var> = <expr>' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:700)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidUseBangBindingNoAndBangs
member.summary: use! may not be combined with and! (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1519)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidUseBangBinding
member.summary: 'use!' bindings must be of the form 'use! <var> = <expr>' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1114)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidUnitsOfMeasurePrefix
member.summary: Units-of-measure cannot be used as prefix arguments to a type. Rewrite as postfix arguments in angle brackets. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:554)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidTypeForUnitsOfMeasure
member.summary: Units-of-measure are only supported on float, float32, decimal, and integer types. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:483)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidTypeForLiteralEnumeration
member.summary: Literal enumerations must have type int, uint, int16, uint16, int64, uint64, byte, sbyte or char (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:800)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidTypeExtension
member.summary: Invalid type extension (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:770)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidTypeArgumentUsage
member.summary: Type arguments cannot be specified here (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:568)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidTypeArgumentCount(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The number of type arguments did not match: '%d' given, '%d' expected. This may be related to a previously reported error. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1226)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidStructReturn
member.summary: The use of '[<Struct>]' on values, functions and methods is only allowed on partial active pattern definitions (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1593)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidSignatureForSet
member.summary: Invalid signature for set member (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:709)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidSequenceExpressionSyntaxForm
member.summary: Invalid record, sequence or computation expression. Sequence expressions should be of the form 'seq { ... }' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:587)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidResumableConstruct(System.String)
member.summary: The construct '%s' may only be used in valid resumable code. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1612)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidRelationInJoin(System.String)
member.summary: Invalid join relation in '%s'. Expected 'expr <op> expr', where <op> is =, =?, ?= or ?=?. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1288)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidRecordConstruction
member.summary: Invalid record construction (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:634)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidPropertyType
member.summary: This property has an invalid type. Properties taking multiple indexer arguments should have types of the form 'ty1 * ty2 -> ty3'. Properties returning functions should have types of the form '(ty1 -> ty2)'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:549)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidPattern
member.summary: This is not a valid pattern (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:578)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidOptionalAssignmentToPropertyOrField
member.summary: Invalid optional assignment to a property or field (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:668)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidOperatorDefinitionRelational(System.String)
member.summary: The '%s' operator should not normally be redefined. To define overloaded comparison semantics for a particular type, implement the 'System.IComparable' interface in the definition of that type. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:497)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidOperatorDefinitionEquality(System.String)
member.summary: The '%s' operator should not normally be redefined. To define equality semantics for a type, override the 'Object.Equals' member in the definition of that type. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:498)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidOperatorDefinition(System.String)
member.summary: The '%s' operator should not normally be redefined. Consider using a different operator name (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:499)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidObjectSequenceOrRecordExpression
member.summary: Invalid object, sequence or record expression (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:586)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidObjectExpressionSyntaxForm
member.summary: Invalid object expression. Objects without overrides or interfaces should use the expression form 'new Type(args)' without braces. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:585)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidObjectConstructionExpression
member.summary: This is not a valid object construction expression. Explicit object constructors must either call an alternate constructor or initialize all fields of the object and specify a call to a super class constructor. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:544)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidNonPrimitiveLiteralInPatternMatch
member.summary: Non-primitive numeric literal constants cannot be used in pattern matches because they can be mapped to multiple different types through the use of a NumericLiteral module. Consider using replacing with a variable, and use 'when <variable> = <constant>' at the end of the match clause. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:567)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidNewConstraint
member.summary: 'new' constraints must take one argument of type 'unit' and return the constructed type (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:548)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidNamespaceModuleTypeUnionName
member.summary: Invalid namespace, module, type or union case name (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:730)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidModuleName
member.summary: Invalid module name (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:769)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidMixtureOfRecursiveForms
member.summary: This recursive binding uses an invalid mixture of recursive forms (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:543)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidMethodNameForRelationalOperator(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The name '(%s)' should not be used as a member name. To define comparison semantics for a type, implement the 'System.IComparable' interface. If defining a static member for use from other CLI languages then use the name '%s' instead. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:493)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidMethodNameForEquality(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The name '(%s)' should not be used as a member name. To define equality semantics for a type, override the 'Object.Equals' member. If defining a static member for use from other CLI languages then use the name '%s' instead. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:494)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidMemberNameFixedTypes(System.String)
member.summary: The name '(%s)' should not be used as a member name because it is given a standard definition in the F# library over fixed types (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:496)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidMemberNameCtor
member.summary: Invalid member name. Members may not have name '.ctor' or '.cctor' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1224)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidMemberName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The name '(%s)' should not be used as a member name. If defining a static member for use from other CLI languages then use the name '%s' instead. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:495)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidMemberDeclNameMissingOrHasParen
member.summary: Invalid member declaration. The name of the member is missing or has parentheses. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1635)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInvalidInlineSpecification

member.summary: This 'inherit' declaration specifies the inherited type but no arguments. Consider supplying arguments, e.g. 'inherit BaseType(args)'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:809)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInheritConstructionCallNotPartOfImplicitSequence
member.summary: This 'inherit' declaration has arguments, but is not in a type with a primary constructor. Consider adding arguments to your type definition, e.g. 'type X(args) = ...'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:810)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInheritCannotBeUsedOnInterfaceType
member.summary: 'inherit' cannot be used on interface types. Consider implementing the interface by using 'interface ... with ... end' instead. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:605)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcInferredGenericTypeGivesRiseToInconsistency(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The function or member '%s' is used in a way that requires further type annotations at its definition to ensure consistency of inferred types. The inferred signature is '%s'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1225)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcIndexNotationDeprecated
member.summary: The syntax 'arr.[idx]' is now revised to 'arr[idx]'. Please update your code. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1562)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcImplicitMeasureFollowingSlash

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcImplicitConversionUsedForMethodArg(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This expression uses the implicit conversion '%s' to convert type '%s' to type '%s'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1609)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcImplementsIStructuralEquatableExplicitly(System.String)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcImplementsIStructuralComparableExplicitly(System.String)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcImplementsIEquatableExplicitly(System.String)
member.summary: The struct, record or union type '%s' implements the interface 'System.IEquatable<_>' explicitly. Apply the 'CustomEquality' attribute to the type and provide a consistent implementation of the non-generic override 'System.Object.Equals(obj)'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:761)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcImplementsIComparableExplicitly(System.String)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcImplementsGenericIComparableExplicitly(System.String)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcIDisposableTypeShouldUseNew

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcHighPrecedenceFunctionApplicationToListReserved

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.tcHighPrecedenceFunctionApplicationToListDeprecated
member.summary: The syntax 'expr1[expr2]' is used for indexing. Consider adding a type annotation to enable indexing, or if calling a function add a space, e.g. 'expr1 [expr2]'. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1561)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keyworkDescriptionAnd
member.summary: Used in mutually recursive bindings, in property declarations, and with multiple constraints on generic parameters. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1397)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionYieldBang
member.summary: Used in a computation expression to append the result of a given computation expression to a collection of results for the containing computation expression. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1464)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionYield
member.summary: Used in a sequence expression to produce a value for a sequence. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1463)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionWith
member.summary: Used together with the match keyword in pattern matching expressions. Also used in object expressions, record copying expressions, and type extensions to introduce member definitions, and to introduce exception handlers. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1462)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionWhile
member.summary: Introduces a looping construct. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1461)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionWhen
member.summary: Used for Boolean conditions (when guards) on pattern matches and to introduce a constraint clause for a generic type parameter. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1460)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionVoid
member.summary: Indicates the .NET void type. Used when interoperating with other .NET languages. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1459)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionVal
member.summary: Used in a signature to indicate a value, or in a type to declare a member, in limited situations. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1458)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionUseBang
member.summary: Used instead of let! in computation expressions for computation expression results that implement IDisposable. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1457)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionUse
member.summary: Used instead of let for values that implement IDisposable (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1456)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionUpcast
member.summary: Used to convert to a type that is higher in the inheritance chain. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1455)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionUntypedQuotation
member.summary: Delimits a untyped code quotation. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1470)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionTypedQuotation
member.summary: Delimits a typed code quotation. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1469)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionType
member.summary: Used to declare a class, record, structure, discriminated union, enumeration type, unit of measure, or type abbreviation. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1454)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionTry
member.summary: Used to introduce a block of code that might generate an exception. Used together with with or finally. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1453)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionTrueFalse
member.summary: Used as a Boolean literal. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1415)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionTo
member.summary: Used in for loops to indicate a range. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1452)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionThen
member.summary: Used in conditional expressions. Also used to perform side effects after object construction. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1451)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionStruct
member.summary: Used to declare a structure type. Also used in generic parameter constraints. Used for OCaml compatibility in module definitions. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1450)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionStatic
member.summary: Used to indicate a method or property that can be called without an instance of a type, or a value member that is shared among all instances of a type. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1449)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionSelect
member.summary: Used in query expressions to specify what fields or columns to extract. Note that this is a contextual keyword, which means that it is not actually a reserved word and it only acts like a keyword in appropriate context. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1448)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionRightArrow
member.summary: In function types, delimits arguments and return values. Yields an expression (in sequence expressions); equivalent to the yield keyword. Used in match expressions (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1465)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionReturnBang
member.summary: Used to provide a value for the result of the containing computation expression, where that value itself comes from the result another computation expression. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1447)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionReturn
member.summary: Used to provide a value for the result of the containing computation expression. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1446)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionRec
member.summary: Used to indicate that a function is recursive. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1445)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionPublic
member.summary: Allows access to a member from outside the type. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1444)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionPrivate
member.summary: Restricts access to a member to code in the same type or module. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1443)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionOverride
member.summary: Used to implement a version of an abstract or virtual method that differs from the base version. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1442)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionOr
member.summary: Used with Boolean conditions as a Boolean or operator. Equivalent to ||. Also used in member constraints. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1441)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionOpen
member.summary: Used to make the contents of a namespace or module available without qualification. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1440)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionOf
member.summary: Used in discriminated unions to indicate the type of categories of values, and in delegate and exception declarations. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1439)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionNull
member.summary: Indicates the absence of an object. Also used in generic parameter constraints. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1438)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionNot
member.summary: Not actually a keyword. However, not struct in combination is used as a generic parameter constraint. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1437)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionNew
member.summary: Used to declare, define, or invoke a constructor that creates or that can create an object. Also used in generic parameter constraints to indicate that a type must have a certain constructor. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1436)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionNamespace
member.summary: Used to associate a name with a group of related types and modules, to logically separate it from other code. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1435)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionMutable
member.summary: Used to declare a variable, that is, a value that can be changed. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1434)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionModule
member.summary: Used to associate a name with a group of related types, values, and functions, to logically separate it from other code. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1433)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionMember
member.summary: Used to declare a property or method in an object type. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1432)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionMatchBang
member.summary: Used in computation expressions to pattern match directly over the result of another computation expression. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1431)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionMatch
member.summary: Used to branch by comparing a value to a pattern. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1430)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionLetBang
member.summary: Used in computation expressions to bind a name to the result of another computation expression. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1429)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionLet
member.summary: Used to associate, or bind, a name to a value or function. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1428)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionLeftArrow
member.summary: Assigns a value to a variable. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1466)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionLazy
member.summary: Used to specify a computation that is to be performed only when a result is needed. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1427)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionInternal
member.summary: Used to specify that a member is visible inside an assembly but not outside it. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1426)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionInterface
member.summary: Used to declare and implement interfaces. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1425)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionInline
member.summary: Used to indicate a function that should be integrated directly into the caller's code. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1424)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionInherit
member.summary: Used to specify a base class or base interface. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1423)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionIn
member.summary: Used for sequence expressions and, in verbose syntax, to separate expressions from bindings. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1422)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionIf
member.summary: Used in conditional branching constructs. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1421)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionGlobal
member.summary: Used to reference the top-level .NET namespace. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1420)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionFunction
member.summary: Used as a shorter alternative to the fun keyword and a match expression in a lambda expression that has pattern matching on a single argument. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1419)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionFun
member.summary: Used in lambda expressions, also known as anonymous functions. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1418)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionFor
member.summary: Used in looping constructs. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1417)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionFinally
member.summary: Used together with try to introduce a block of code that executes regardless of whether an exception occurs. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1416)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionExtern
member.summary: Indicates that a declared program element is defined in another binary or assembly. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1414)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionException
member.summary: Used to declare an exception type. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1413)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionEnd
member.summary: In type definitions and type extensions, indicates the end of a section of member definitions. In verbose syntax, used to specify the end of a code block that starts with the begin keyword. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1412)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionElse
member.summary: Used in conditional branching. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1411)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionElif
member.summary: Used in conditional branching. A short form of else if. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1410)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionDynamicCast
member.summary: Converts a type to a type that is lower in the hierarchy. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1468)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionDownto
member.summary: In a for expression, used when counting in reverse. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1409)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionDowncast
member.summary: Used to convert to a type that is lower in the inheritance chain. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1408)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionDone
member.summary: In verbose syntax, indicates the end of a block of code in a looping expression. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1407)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionDo
member.summary: Used in looping constructs or to execute imperative code. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1406)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionDelegate
member.summary: Used to declare a delegate. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1405)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionDefault
member.summary: Indicates an implementation of an abstract method; used together with an abstract method declaration to create a virtual method. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1404)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionConst
member.summary: Keyword to specify a constant literal as a type parameter argument in Type Providers. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1403)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionClass
member.summary: In verbose syntax, indicates the start of a class definition. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1402)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionCast
member.summary: Converts a type to type that is higher in the hierarchy. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1467)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionBegin
member.summary: In verbose syntax, indicates the start of a code block. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1401)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionBase
member.summary: Used as the name of the base class object. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1400)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionAssert
member.summary: Used to verify code during debugging. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1399)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionAs
member.summary: Used to give the current class object an object name. Also used to give a name to a whole pattern within a pattern match. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1398)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.keywordDescriptionAbstract
member.summary: Indicates a method that either has no implementation in the type in which it is declared or that is virtual and has a default implementation. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1396)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.activePatternChoiceHasFreeTypars(System.String)
member.summary: Active pattern '%s' has a result type containing type variables that are not determined by the input. The common cause is a when a result case is not mentioned, e.g. 'let (|A|B|) (x:int) = A x'. This can be fixed with a type constraint, e.g. 'let (|A|B|) (x:int) : Choice<int,unit> = A x' (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:1099)

member.name: M:FSComp.SR.ValueNotContainedMutabilityAritiesDiffer(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Module '%s' contains
 %s 
but its signature specifies
 %s 
The arities in the signature and implementation differ. The signature specifies that '%s' is function definition or lambda expression accepting at least %s argument(s), but the implementation is a computed function value. To declare that a computed function value is a permitted implementation simply parenthesize its type in the signature, e.g.
	val %s: int -> (int -> int)
instead of
	val %s: int -> int -> int. (Originally from ..\FSComp.txt:112)

member.name: T:Internal.Utilities.Collections.MruCache`3
member.summary:
Simple priority caching for a small number of key/value associations. This cache may age-out results that have been Set by the caller. Because of this, the caller must be able to tolerate values that aren't what was originally passed to the Set function.
Concurrency: This collection is thread-safe, though concurrent use may result in different threads seeing different live sets of cached items.
- areSimilar: Keep at most once association for two similar keys (as given by areSimilar)

Simple aging lookup table. When a member is accessed it's moved to the top of the list and when there are too many elements the least-recently-accessed element falls of the end.

member.name: T:Internal.Utilities.Collections.QueueList`1
member.summary:
Iterable functional collection with O(1) append-1 time. Useful for data structures where elements get added at the end but the collection must occasionally be iterated. Iteration is slower and may allocate because a suffix of elements is stored in reverse order.
The type doesn't support structural hashing or comparison.

member.name: T:Internal.Utilities.Collections.Tagged.Map`3
member.summary:
Immutable maps. Keys are ordered by construction function specified when creating empty maps or by F# structural comparison if no construction function is specified.
<performance> Maps based on structural comparison are efficient for small keys. They are not a suitable choice if keys are recursive data structures or require non-structural comparison semantics. </performance> Immutable maps. A constraint tag carries information about the class of key-comparers being used.

member.name: T:Internal.Utilities.Library.Cancellable`1
member.summary:
Represents a synchronous cancellable computation with explicit representation of a cancelled result.
A cancellable computation is passed may be cancelled via a CancellationToken, which is propagated implicitly. If cancellation occurs, it is propagated as data rather than by raising an OperationCanceledException.

member.name: T:Internal.Utilities.Library.Lock`1
member.summary: Encapsulates a lock associated with a particular token-type representing the acquisition of that lock.

member.name: T:Internal.Utilities.Library.LockToken
member.summary: A base type for various types of tokens that must be passed when a lock is taken. Each different static lock should declare a new subtype of this type.

member.name: T:Internal.Utilities.Library.AnyCallerThreadToken
member.summary: Represents a token that indicates execution on any of several potential user threads calling the F# compiler services.

member.name: T:Internal.Utilities.Library.CompilationThreadToken
member.summary:
Represents a token that indicates execution on the compilation thread, i.e. - we have full access to the (partially mutable) TAST and TcImports data structures - compiler execution may result in type provider invocations when resolving types and members - we can access various caches in the SourceCodeServices
Like other execution tokens this should be passed via argument passing and not captured/stored beyond the lifetime of stack-based calls. This is not checked, it is a discipline within the compiler code.

member.name: T:Internal.Utilities.Library.ExecutionToken
member.summary: Represents a permission active at this point in execution
For every entry in m2 find an entry in m1 and fold

member.summary: Split a large ResizeArray into a series of array chunks that are each under the Large Object Heap limit. This is done to help prevent a stop-the-world collection of the single large array, instead allowing for a greater probability of smaller collections. Stop-the-world is still possible, just less likely.

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.ErrorLogger.ReportedError
member.summary:
Thrown when immediate, local error recovery is not possible. This indicates we've reported an error but need to make a non-local transfer of control. Error recovery may catch this and continue (see 'errorRecovery')
The exception that caused the report is carried as data because in some situations (LazyWithContext) we may need to re-report the original error when a lazy thunk is re-evaluated.

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.Text.FormatOptions
member.summary:
A record of options to control structural formatting. For F# Interactive properties matching those of this value can be accessed via the 'fsi' value.
Floating Point format given in the same format accepted by System.Double.ToString, e.g. f6 or g15.
If ShowProperties is set the printing process will evaluate properties of the values being displayed. This may cause additional computation.
The ShowIEnumerable is set the printing process will force the evaluation of IEnumerable objects to a small, finite depth, as determined by the printing parameters. This may lead to additional computation being performed during printing.

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.Text.LayoutModule
member.summary: A layout is a sequence of strings which have been joined together. The strings are classified as words, separators and left and right parenthesis. This classification determines where spaces are inserted. A joint is either unbreakable, breakable or broken. If a joint is broken the RHS layout occurs on the next line with optional indentation. A layout can be squashed to for given width which forces breaks as required.

member.name: M:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.IL.ILGlobals.IsPossiblePrimaryAssemblyRef(FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.IL.ILAssemblyRef)
member.summary: Is the given assembly possibly a primary assembly? In practice, a primary assembly is an assembly that contains the System.Object type definition and has no referenced assemblies. However, we must consider assemblies that forward the System.Object type definition to be possible primary assemblies. Therefore, this will return true if the given assembly is the real primary assembly or an assembly that forwards the System.Object type definition. Assembly equivalency ignores the version here.

member.name: P:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.IL.ILAssemblyManifest.AuxModuleHashAlgorithm
member.summary: This is the ID of the algorithm used for the hashes of auxiliary files in the assembly. These hashes are stored in the <c>ILModuleRef.Hash</c> fields of this assembly. These are not cryptographic hashes: they are simple file hashes. The algorithm is normally <c>0x00008004</c> indicating the SHA1 hash algorithm.

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.IL.ILExportedTypeOrForwarder
member.summary: these are only found in the ILExportedTypesAndForwarders table in the manifest

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.IL.ILNestedExportedType
member.summary:
"Classes Elsewhere" - classes in auxiliary modules.
Manifests include declarations for all the classes in an assembly, regardless of which module they are in.
The ".class extern" construct describes so-called exported types -- these are public classes defined in the auxiliary modules of this assembly, i.e. modules other than the manifest-carrying module.
For example, if you have a two-module assembly (A.DLL and B.DLL), and the manifest resides in the A.DLL, then in the manifest all the public classes declared in B.DLL should be defined as exported types, i.e., as ".class extern". The public classes defined in A.DLL should not be defined as ".class extern" -- they are already available in the manifest-carrying module. The union of all public classes defined in the manifest-carrying module and all exported types defined there is the set of all classes exposed by this assembly. Thus, by analysing the metadata of the manifest-carrying module of an assembly, you can identify all the classes exposed by this assembly, and where to find them.
Nested classes found in external modules should also be located in this table, suitably nested inside another "ILExportedTypeOrForwarder" definition. these are only found in the "Nested" field of ILExportedTypeOrForwarder objects

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.IL.ILPreTypeDef
member.summary:
Represents a prefix of information for ILTypeDef.
The information is enough to perform name resolution for the F# compiler, probe attributes for ExtensionAttribute etc. This is key to the on-demand exploration of .NET metadata. This information has to be "Goldilocks" - not too much, not too little, just right.

member.summary: Generate references to existing type definitions, method definitions etc. Useful for generating references, e.g. to a class we're processing Also used to reference type definitions that we've generated. Making modules.

member.name: M:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.IL.mkILTypeDefsComputed(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit,FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.IL.ILPreTypeDef[]})
member.summary:
Create table of types which is loaded/computed on-demand, and whose individual elements are also loaded/computed on-demand. Any call to tdefs.AsList will result in the laziness being forced. Operations can examine the custom attributes and name of each type in order to decide whether to proceed with examining the other details of the type.
Note that individual type definitions may contain further delays in their method, field and other tables.

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.Morphs
member.summary: A set of "IL rewrites" ("morphs"). These map each sub-construct of particular ILTypeDefs. The morphing functions are passed some details about the context in which the item being morphed occurs, e.g. the module being morphed itself, the ILTypeDef (possibly nested) where the item occurs, the ILMethodDef (if any) where the item occurs. etc.

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.StrongNameSign
member.summary: Functions associated with signing il assemblies which vary between supported implementations of the CLI Common Language Runtime, e.g. between the SSCLI, Mono and the Microsoft CLR.

member.name: M:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.Support.linkNativeResources(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{System.Byte[]},System.Int32)
member.summary: Unmanaged resource file linker - for native resources (not managed ones). The function may be called twice, once with a zero-RVA and arbitrary buffer, and once with the real buffer. The size of the required buffer is returned.

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.Support

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.ILBinaryReader.Shim
member.summary: The public API hook for changing the IL assembly reader, used by Resharper

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.ILBinaryReader
member.summary:
Binary reader. Read a .NET binary and concert it to Abstract IL data structures.
NOTE: - The metadata in the loaded modules will be relative to those modules, e.g. ILScopeRef.Local will mean "local to that module". You must use [rescopeILType] etc. if you want to include (i.e. copy) the metadata into your own module.
- PDB (debug info) reading/folding: The PDB reader is invoked if you give a PDB path This indicates if you want to search for PDB files and have the reader fold them in. You cannot currently name the pdb file directly - you can only name the path. Giving "None" says "do not read the PDB file even if one exists".
The debug info appears primarily as I_seqpoint annotations in the instruction streams. Unfortunately the PDB information does not, for example, tell you how to map back from a class definition to a source code line number - you will need to explicitly search for a sequence point in the code for one of the methods of the class. That is not particularly satisfactory, and it may be a good idea to build a small library which extracts the information you need.

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.ILPdbWriter.PdbImport
member.summary:
Defines the set of 'imports' - that is, opened namespaces, types etc. - at each code location
Note the C# debug evaluation engine used for F# will give C# semantics to these. That in general is very close to F# semantics, except for things like union type.

member.name: P:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.ILPdbWriter.PdbLocalVar.Index
member.summary: the local index the name corresponds to

member.name: M:FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.ILPdbWriter.unshadowScopes(FSharp.Compiler.AbstractIL.ILPdbWriter.PdbMethodScope)
member.summary:
Check to see if a scope has a local with the same name as any of its children
If so, do not emit 'scope' itself. Instead, 1. Emit a copy of 'scope' in each true gap, with all locals 2. Adjust each child scope to also contain the locals from 'scope', adding the text " (shadowed)" to the names of those with name conflicts.

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.ExtensionTyping.ProvidedTypeContext
member.summary:
The context used to interpret information in the closure of System.Type, System.MethodInfo and other info objects coming from the type provider.
At the moment this is the "Type --> ILTypeRef" and "Type --> Tycon" remapping context for generated types (it is empty for erased types). This is computed from while processing the [<Generate>] declaration related to the type.
Immutable (after type generation for a [<Generate>] declaration populates the dictionaries).
The 'obj' values are all TyconRef, but obj is used due to a forward reference being required. Not particularly pleasant, but better than intertwining the whole "ProvidedType" with the TAST structure.

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.CompilerGlobalState.StableNiceNameGenerator
member.summary:
Generates compiler-generated names marked up with a source code location, but if given the same unique value then return precisely the same name. Each name generated also includes the StartLine number of the range passed in at the point of first generation.
This type may be accessed concurrently, though in practice it is only used from the compilation thread. It is made concurrency-safe since a global instance of the type is allocated in tast.fs.

member.name: T:FSharp.Compiler.CompilerGlobalState.NiceNameGenerator
member.summary:
Generates compiler-generated names. Each name generated also includes the StartLine number of the range passed in at the point of first generation.
This type may be accessed concurrently, though in practice it is only used from the compilation thread. It is made concurrency-safe since a global instance of the type is allocated in tast.fs, and it is good policy to make all globally-allocated objects concurrency safe in case future versions of the compiler are used to host multiple concurrent instances of compilation.

member.summary: Concurrency-safe

member.summary: Indicates if the expression contains a call to rethrow that is not bound under a (try-)with branch. Rethrow may only occur in such locations.

member.name: P:FSharp.Compiler.TypedTree.FreeVars.UsesMethodLocalConstructs
member.summary: Indicates if the expression contains a call to a protected member or a base call. Calls to protected members and direct calls to super classes can't escape, also code can't be inlined

member.summary: The summary of locally defined variables used in the expression. These may be hidden at let bindings etc. or made private by a signature or marked 'internal' or 'private', and we have to check various conditions associated with that.
